  3#ifndef VSIP_CORE_USER_STORAGE_HPP
  4#define VSIP_CORE_USER_STORAGE_HPP
  5
  6#include <vsip/core/storage.hpp>
  7
  8namespace vsip
  9{
 10
 11enum user_storage_type 
 12{
 13  no_user_format = 0,
 14  array_format,
 15  interleaved_format,
 16  split_format
 17};
 18
 19namespace impl
 20{
 21
 22/// Class to hold storage that has been given to us by the user.
 23/// For complex data, this can be in three different formats (array
 24/// of complex, array of interleaved real, or arrays of split real).
 25/// The block value type does not determine/restrict which type of
 26/// data the block can be constructed with.
 27///
 28/// General case intended for non-complex types.
 29template <typename T>
 30class User_storage
 31{
 32public:
 33  User_storage() : format_(no_user_format), data_(0) {}
 34  User_storage(user_storage_type format, T* data)
 35    : format_(format), data_(data)
 36  { assert(format == array_format);}
 37
 38  /// This constructor is provided so that `User_storage<T>` and
 39  /// `User_storage<complex<T> >` can be interchanged, however it
 40  /// should not be called.
 41  User_storage(user_storage_type format, T* real, T* /*imag*/)
 42    : format_(format), data_(real)
 43  { assert(0);}
 44
 45  user_storage_type format() const { return format_;}
 46
 47  T    get(index_type i) { return this->data_[i];}
 48  void put(index_type i, T val) { this->data_[i] = val;}
 49
 50  /// Return the user storage in a format acceptable for initializing
 51  /// a Storage class.
 52  typename Storage<Cmplx_inter_fmt, T>::type as_storage(Cmplx_inter_fmt) const
 53  {
 54    assert(this->format_ == array_format);
 55    return this->data_;
 56  }
 57
 58  // For scalar types, there is no distinction between interleaved and
 59  // split.
 60  typename Storage<Cmplx_split_fmt, T>::type as_storage(Cmplx_split_fmt) const
 61  {
 62    assert(this->format_ == array_format);
 63    return this->data_;
 64  }
 65
 66  void find(T *&pointer) { pointer = this->data_;}
 67  void rebind(T *pointer) { this->data_ = pointer;}
 68
 69private:
 70  user_storage_type format_;
 71  T* data_;
 72};
 73
 74
 75
 76/// User_storage specialization for complex types.
 77///
 78/// Can store user-storage in array format, interleaved format, or
 79/// split format.
 80template <typename T>
 81class User_storage<complex<T> >
 82{
 83public:
 84  User_storage()
 85    : format_(no_user_format)
 86  {
 87    // Zero everything out so that find() returns NULL values.
 88    this->u_.data_ = 0;
 89    this->u_.split_.real_ = 0;
 90    this->u_.split_.imag_ = 0;
 91  }
 92
 93  User_storage(user_storage_type format, complex<T> *data)
 94    : format_(format)
 95  {
 96    assert(format == array_format);
 97    this->u_.data_ = data;
 98  }
 99
100  User_storage(user_storage_type format, T *real, T *imag)
101    : format_(format)
102  { 
103    assert(format == interleaved_format || format == split_format);
104    this->u_.split_.real_ = real;
105    this->u_.split_.imag_ = imag;
106  }
107
108  user_storage_type format() const { return this->format_;}
109
110  complex<T> get(index_type i)
111  {
112    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
113
114    if (this->format_ == array_format)
115      return this->u_.data_[i];
116    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
117      return complex<T>(this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+0],
118			this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+1]);
119    else // if (format_ == split_format)
120      return complex<T>(this->u_.split_.real_[i],
121			this->u_.split_.imag_[i]);
122  }
123
124  void put(index_type i, complex<T> val)
125  {
126    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
127
128    if (this->format_ == array_format)
129      this->u_.data_[i] = val;
130    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
131    {
132      this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+0] = val.real();
133      this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+1] = val.imag();
134    }
135    else // if (format_ == split_format)
136    {
137      this->u_.split_.real_[i] = val.real();
138      this->u_.split_.imag_[i] = val.imag();
139    }
140  }
141
142  /// Return the user storage in a format acceptable for initializing
143  /// a Storage class with array/interleaved format, or return NULL.
144  typename Storage<Cmplx_inter_fmt, complex<T> >::type
145  as_storage(Cmplx_inter_fmt) const
146  {
147    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
148
149    if (this->format_ == array_format)
150      return this->u_.data_;
151    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
152      return (complex<T>*)this->u_.split_.real_;
153    else // if (format_ == split_format)
154      return NULL;
155  }
156
157  /// Return the user storage in a format acceptable for initializing
158  /// a Storage class with split format, or return effective NULL.
159  typename Storage<Cmplx_split_fmt, complex<T> >::type
160  as_storage(Cmplx_split_fmt) const
161  {
162    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
163
164    if (this->format_ == array_format)
165      return std::pair<T*, T*>(0, 0);
166    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
167      return std::pair<T*, T*>(0, 0);
168    else // if (format_ == split_format)
169      return std::pair<T*, T*>(this->u_.split_.real_, this->u_.split_.imag_);
170  }
171
172  void find(complex<T> *&pointer) { pointer = this->u_.data_;}
173  void find(T *&pointer) { pointer = this->u_.split_.real_;}
174  void find(T *&real_pointer, T *&imag_pointer)
175  {
176    real_pointer = this->u_.split_.real_;
177    imag_pointer = this->u_.split_.imag_;
178  }
179
180  void rebind(complex<T> *pointer)
181  {
182    this->u_.data_ = pointer;
183    this->format_  = array_format;
184  }
185
186  void rebind(T *pointer)
187  {
188    this->u_.split_.real_ = pointer; 
189    this->format_         = interleaved_format;
190  }
191
192  void rebind(T *real_pointer, T *imag_pointer)
193  {
194    this->u_.split_.real_ = real_pointer;
195    this->u_.split_.imag_ = imag_pointer;
196    this->format_         = imag_pointer ? split_format : interleaved_format;
197  }
198
199private:
200  user_storage_type format_;
201  union 
202  {
203    complex<T> *data_;
204    struct 
205    {
206      T *real_;
207      T *imag_;
208    } split_;
209  } u_;
210};
211
212} // namespace vsip::impl
213} // namespace vsip
214
215#endif
